title: Jurgen Klopp confirms Liverpool duo Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge have "no chance" of facing Man City
text:
Sport Jurgen Klopp confirms Liverpool duo Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge have "no chance" of facing Man City Roberto Firmino and Divock Origi are also doubts but Dejan Lovren is fit for the clash at the Etihad Share Jurgen Klopp looks on (Photo: Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge have been ruled out of Liverpool's clash with Manchester City. 
Reds skipper Henderson has been out with a foot problem while Sturridge remains sidelined. 
Both players were left out of the England squad by Gareth Southgate for the upcoming internationals. 
And Jurgen Klopp has confirmed both had "no chance" of playing at the Etihad on Sunday. 
The Liverpool boss remains confident Henderson will play in the Merseyside derby on April 1. Henderson remains sidelined (Photo: REUTERS) Sturridge is also out (Photo: John Powell) 
Klopp went on to admit Roberto Firmino is a doubt, along with Divock Origi. 
The Brazilian missed last weekend's win over Burnley but was back in light training this week. 
"Firmino didnâ€™t train with team so far, but should either today or tomorrow."
